questions.questionText: What are the four pillars of OOP?
questions.explanation:
The four pillars of Object-Oriented Programming form the foundation of object-based design.

• Encapsulation
Encapsulation means wrapping data and the methods that operate on it into a single unit (class) and restricting direct access to internal data. This improves security and makes the code easier to maintain.

• Abstraction
Abstraction focuses on exposing only essential features while hiding complex implementation details. It helps reduce complexity and allows developers to work with simpler interfaces.

• Inheritance
Inheritance allows a class to reuse and extend the properties and behavior of another class. This promotes code reusability and creates a clear class hierarchy.

• Polymorphism
Polymorphism allows the same method or interface to behave differently based on the object that invokes it. This makes the system flexible, extensible, and easier to scale.
